digitalTwinsModels.description: A set of strings, each annotated by the language of the string. The meaning of the string in each language shall be the same.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: Not part of the ISA95 standard. But enables multi language strings

contents.name: langString
contents.description: A set of strings, each annotated by the language of the string. The meaning of the stringin each language shall be the same.

mapKey.name: iso2Code
mapKey.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes are two-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard

mapValue.name: langSpecString
mapValue.description: A string in a specified language

digitalTwinsModels.description: You can use the concept of tags to further identify and categorize your digital twins
digitalTwinsModels.comment: Not part of the AAS meta model. Makes querying easier. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/digital-twins/how-to-use-tags

contents.name: markers
contents.description: A marker tag is a simple string that is used to mark or categorize a digital twin, such as 'blue' or 'red'. This string is the tag's name, and marker tags have no meaningful value—the tag is significant just by its presence (or absence).

contents.name: values
contents.description: A value tag is a key-value pair that is used to give each tag a value, such as 'color': 'blue' or 'color': 'red'. Once a value tag is created, it can also be used as a marker tag by ignoring the tag's value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: The hierarchy scope identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role-based equipment hierarchy. It defines the scope of the exchanged information, such as a site or area for ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 – 19 –which the information is relevant. The hierarchy scope identifies the associated instance in the role-based equipment hierarchy.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The child hierarchy scope(s) contained within this hierarchy scope.

contents.name: equipmentID
contents.description: unique identification of an equipment element

contents.name: equipmentLevel
contents.description: Identification of the equipment level if the equipment element is defined

digitalTwinsModels.description: Abstract base model for all ISA-95 models
digitalTwinsModels.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 standard

contents.name: ID
contents.description: Objects in the information model which require unique identifications contain an ID attribute, which are unique within the scope of the exchanged information
contents.comment: According to 4.5.5.1 Object identification in ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018

contents.name: tags
contents.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 standard. Makes querying easier. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/digital-twins/how-to-use-tags

digitalTwinsModels.description: A generic site asset in the physical asset equipment hierarchy
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Work centers are elements of the equipment hierarchy under an area. The term work center may be used when the specific type of the equipment element is not significant for the purpose of the discussion.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

contents.name: workUnit
contents.description: Reference to a contained work unit of the work center
contents.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 Standard. Just to make the graph easier to handle

digitalTwinsModels.description: An area is a physical, geographical, or logical grouping determined by the site. It may contain work centers such as process cells, production units, production lines, and storage zones. Most Level 3 functions occur within the area. The main production capability and geographical location within a site usually identify areas.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

contents.name: workCenter
contents.description: Reference to a contained work center of the area
contents.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 Standard. Just to make the graph easier to handle

digitalTwinsModels.description: A site is a physical, geographical, or logical grouping determined by the enterprise. It may contain areas, production lines, process cells, and production units. The Level 4 functions at a site are involved in local site management and optimization. Site planning and scheduling may involve work centers or work units within the areas.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

contents.name: area
contents.description: Reference to a contained area of the site
contents.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 Standard. Just to make the graph easier to handle

contents.name: asset
contents.description: Reference to a contained asset of the site

digitalTwinsModels.description: An enterprise is a collection of sites and areas and represents the top level of a role based equipment hierarchy. The enterprise is responsible for determining what products will be manufactured, at which sites they will be manufactured, and in general how they will be manufactured.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

contents.name: site
contents.description: Reference to a contained site of the enterprise
contents.comment: Not part of the ISA-95 Standard. Just to make the graph easier to handle

digitalTwinsModels.description: Process cells and units are the lowest level of equipment typically scheduled by the Level 4 and Level 3 functions for batch manufacturing processes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Production lines and work cells are the lowest levels of equipment typically scheduled by the Level 4 or Level 3 functions for discrete manufacturing processes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: A production unit generally encompasses all of the equipment required for a segment of continuous production that operates in a relatively autonomous manner.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: A work unit is any element of the equipment hierarchy under a work center. Work units are the lowest form of elements in an equipment hierarchy that are typically scheduled by Level 3 functions.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Storage zones and storage units are the lowest level of material movement equipment typically scheduled by the Level 4 and Level 3 functions for discrete, batch and continuous manufacturing processes. A storage zone is a type of work center and a storage unit is a type of work unit that is organized as elements within an area. These are the lower-level elements of an equipment hierarchy used in material storage and movement activities.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Storage zones and storage units are the lowest level of material movement equipment typically scheduled by the Level 4 and Level 3 functions for discrete, batch and continuous manufacturing processes. A storage zone is a type of work center and a storage unit is a type of work unit that is organized as elements within an area. These are the lower-level elements of an equipment hierarchy used in material storage and movement activities.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Units have well-defined processing capabilities and throughput capacities and these are used for Level 3 functions. T
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: Work cells are usually only identified when there is flexibility in the routing of work within a production line.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.01-2010 (IEC 62264-1 Mod) Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 1: Models and Terminology - Approved 13 May 2010

digitalTwinsModels.description: A representation of a grouping of equipment with similar characteristics for a definite purpose such as manufacturing operations definition, scheduling, capability and performance shall be presented as an equipment class. Any piece of equipment may be a member of zero or more equipment classes. An equipment class may be defined as a specialization of zero or more equipment classes. An equipment class may be made up of zero or more equipment classes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: includesPropertiesOf
contents.description: This equipment class(s) include properties of the equipment class.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: This parent equipment class is whole of the child equipment class(s) as the part.

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The equipment class property(s) of this equipment class.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the equipment class

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the equipment class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: equipmentLevel
contents.description: Identification of the equipment level if the equipment element is defined

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of equipment shall be presented as equipment properties. An equipment shall have zero or more equipment properties. These specify the current property values of the equipment for the associated equipment class property.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The nested equipment property(s) makes up part of this equipment property as the whole.

contents.name: mapsTo
contents.description: If the parent equipment supports an equipment class, the equipment class property(s) is applied in this equipment property(s).

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the equipment property.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: The spatial definition provides a means of communicating zero-dimensional point, one-dimensional line, or two-dimensional shape or three-dimensional solid geospatial location data for planning/scheduling, actuals, resources, and analytics.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: value
contents.description: A string to uniquely identify a spatial definition. EXAMPLE 1 UN/CEFACT CCTS: TextType) of the geospatial information in the format indicated in the format attribute.

contents.name: format
contents.description: An enumerator that determines the format of the value attribute. E.g. GPX, WKT, ...

contents.name: SRID
contents.description: SRID is the Spatial Reference Identifier which identifies the coordinate reference system to identify a predefined coordinate

contents.name: SRIDauthority
contents.description: The SRID authority identifies the authority that defines the coordinate reference system identified by the SRID.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A representation of the elements of the equipment hierarchy model shown in ISA-95.00.01 shall be presented as equipment. Equipment may be a listing of any of the following: enterprise, site, area, work center, work unit, process cell, unit, production line, production unit, work cell, storage zone, and storage unit.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: definedBy
contents.description: Equipment classes supported by this equipment.

contents.name: hasValuesOf
contents.description: The equipment property values of this equipment.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: The related object(s) makes up part of this equipment as the whole.

contents.name: testSpecification
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the equipment

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: equipmentLevel
contents.description: An identification of the level in the role-based equipment hierarchy

contents.name: spatialDefinition
contents.description: Spatially defines the equipment as a zero-dimensional point, one dimensional line, or two dimensional shape or three dimensional solid.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An equipment class property may be tested to the evaluated property in a test specification where the measured results may be recorded in a property measurement attribute in a test result. The measured results may also be evaluated to the test specification criteria in the test specification that references the evaluated property where they may be recorded in an evaluated criterion result attribute in the test result. Equipment class properties may contain nested equipment class properties.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The nested equipment class property(s) makes up part of thisequipment class property as the whole

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the equipment class property

contents.name: propertyType
contents.description: Defines the type of the property.

enumValues.name: classType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class and there is no value associated with an instance

enumValues.name: instanceType
enumValues.description: the property value of the class is undefined

enumValues.name: defaultType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class as the default instance value, but individual instances of the class may redefine specific values.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

digitalTwinsModels.description: A representation of a grouping of operational locations with similar characteristics for a definite purpose such as manufacturing operations definition, scheduling, capability and performance shall be presented as an operational location class. Any operational location may be a member of zero or more operational location classes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: includesPropertiesOf
contents.description: This operational location class(s) include properties of the operational location class.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: This parent operational location class is whole of the child operational location class(s) as the part

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The operational location class property(s) of this operational location class

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the operational location class

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the equipment class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of operational locations shall be presented as operational location properties. Anoperational location shall have zero or more operational location properties. These specify the current property values of the operational location for the associated operational location class property. Operational location properties may include a unit of measure.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The child operational location property(s) of this operational location property.

contents.name: mapsTo
contents.description: The operational location class property to which this operational location class property maps.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the asset property.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

digitalTwinsModels.description: A logical or physical location where a material lot, material sublot, equipment, physical asset or person is located or expected to be located shall be presented as an operational location. Operational locations may be made up of other operational locations.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: definedBy
contents.description: The operational location class(s) to which this operational location belongs

contents.name: hasValuesOf
contents.description: The operational location property(s) of this operational location.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: The child operational location(s) contained within this operational location.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the operational location.

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scopedefines the scope of the physical asset class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: spatialDefinition
contents.description: Spatially defines the equipment as a zero-dimensional point, one dimensional line, or two dimensional shape or three dimensional solid.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of an operational location class shall be defined as operational location class property(s). An operational location class property may contain nested operational location class property(s). An operational location class property may have zero or more operational location property(s) mapping to it.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The child operational location class property(s) of this operational location class property.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the operational location class property

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

contents.name: propertyType
contents.description: Defines the type of the property.

enumValues.name: classType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class and there is no value associated with an instance

enumValues.name: instanceType
enumValues.description: the property value of the class is undefined

enumValues.name: defaultType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class as the default instance value, but individual instances of the class may redefine specific values.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A representation of a grouping of persons with similar characteristics for a definite purpose such as manufacturing operations definition, scheduling, capability and performance shall be presented as a personnel class. Any person may be a member of zero or more personnel classes. A personnel class may be defined as a specialization of zero or more personnel class. A personnel class may be made up of zero or more personnel class(s).
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: includesPropertiesOf
contents.description: This personnel class(s)include properties of the personnel class.

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The personnel class property(s)of this personnel class.

contents.name: specifies
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information and description about the personnel class.

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the equipment class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties  of  a person shall  be  presented as person  properties. Each person shall  have  zero  or more person properties. These specify the current property values of the person for the associated personnel class property.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: This nested person property(s)is part of the person property as the whole.

contents.name: mapsTo
contents.description: If the person supports the parent personnel class,the personnel class property(s)is applied in this person property(s).

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the person property.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

digitalTwinsModels.description: A  representation  of  a  specifically  identified  individual shall  be  presented  as  a person. A person may be a member of zero or more personnel classes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: definedBy
contents.description: Personnel classes supported by this person.This person supports the personnel class property(s) associated with the personnel class.

contents.name: hasValuesOf
contents.description: The person property values of this person.

contents.name: specifies
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the resource.

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role-based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the person definition.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: name
contents.description: The name of the individual.This is meant as an additional identification of the resource, but only as information and not as a unique value.

contents.name: spatialDefinition
contents.description: Spatially defines the personas a zero-dimensional point, one-dimensional line, or two-dimensional shape or three-dimensional solid,/ / WKT / POLYGON ( ( -646.99 676.18, -645.14 683.09, -

contents.name: operationalLocation
contents.description: Identifies the operational location of the person.

contents.name: operationalLocationType
contents.description: Indicates whether the operational location attribute refers to an operational location object or contains a description of the operational location.Mandatory where an operational location attribute is specified.Defined values are operational location:operational location attribute references an operational location;description:operational location attribute contains a description of the operational location, such as a street address.

enumValues.name: operationalLocation
enumValues.description: operational location attribute references an operational location;

enumValues.name: description
enumValues.description: operational location attribute contains a description of the operational location, such as a street address.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of a personnel class shall be presented as personnel class properties. Each personnel class shall have zero or more recognized properties
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The nested personnel class property(s) makes up part of this personnel class property as the whole.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information and description about the personnel class property.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

contents.name: propertyType
contents.description: Defines the type of the property.

enumValues.name: classType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class and there is no value associated with an instance

enumValues.name: instanceType
enumValues.description: the property value of the class is undefined

enumValues.name: defaultType
enumValues.description: The property value is defined for the class as the default instance value, but individual instances of the class may redefine specific values.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A representation of a grouping of physical assets with similar characteristics for purposes of repair and replacement shall be presented as a physical asset class. Any physical asset shall be a member of one physical asset class. A physical asset class may be defined as a specialization of zero or more physical asset classes. A physical asset class may be made up of zero or more physical asset classes.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: includesPropertiesOf
contents.description: This physical asset class(s) include properties of the physical asset class.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: This parent physical asset class is whole of the child physical asset class(s) as the part.

contents.name: hasPropertiesOf
contents.description: The physical asset class property(s) of this physical asset class.

contents.name: specifies
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: manufacturer
contents.description: An identification of the manufacturer.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the property class asset

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scopedefines the scope of the physical asset class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: testSpecification
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of physical assets shall be presented as physical asset properties. A physical asset shall have zero or more physical asset properties. These specify the current property values of the physical asset for the associated physical asset class property. Physical asset properties may include a unit of measure.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: contains
contents.description: The nested physical asset property(s) makes up part of this physical asset property as the whole.

contents.name: mapsTo
contents.description: If the parent physical asset supports a physical asset class, the physical asset class property(s) is applied in this physical asset property(s).This physical asset property maps to the corresponding physical asset class property.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the asset property.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

contents.name: valueUnitOfMeasure
contents.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value

digitalTwinsModels.description: A physical piece of equipment shall be presented as a physical asset.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

contents.name: definedBy
contents.description: Physical asset classes supported by this physical asset. This physical asset supports the physical asset class property(s) associated with the physical asset class.

contents.name: hasValuesOf
contents.description: The physical asset property values of this physical asset.

contents.name: isMadeUpOf
contents.description: The related object(s) makes up part of this physical asset as the whole.

contents.name: specifies
contents.description: The test specification(s) used to evaluate this testable object.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Additional information about the physical asset

contents.name: hierarchyScope
contents.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scopedefines the scope of the physical asset class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

contents.name: hierarchyScopeRel
contents.description: Optional relationship to hierarchy.
contents.comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

contents.name: fixedAssetID
contents.description: Contains a unique identification for financial tracking as required by laws or regulations

contents.name: vendorID
contents.description: Contains a vendors serial number

contents.name: spatialDefinition
contents.description: Spatially defines the physical asset as a zero-dimensional point, one-dimensional line, or two-dimensional shape or three dimensional solid.

contents.name: physicalLocation
contents.description: Contains a vendors serial number

contents.name: physicalocationType
contents.description: Indicates whether the physical location attribute refers to an operational location object or contains a description of the physical location. Mandatory where a physical location attribute is specified. Defined values are operational location: physical location attribute references an operational location; description: physical location attribute contains a description of the physical location, such as a street address.

enumValues.description: physical location attribute references an operational location

enumValues.description: physical location attribute contains a description of the physical location, such as a street address.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Properties of a physical asset class shall be presented as physical asset class properties. Each may have zero or more recognized properties.
digitalTwinsModels.comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.02-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration − Part 2: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018
